repaint() won’t make the image appear unless you use it like four times in a row, in which case the best idea is to use a loop.
[/quote]

Why not?[/quote]

Because Java is a hater or because I am not doing it right.

item.title: Making an applet load another picture upon releasing a certain key.(->)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

There is a special way to get the Image from an applet without using any streams. You can use the following:

ImageIcon icon = new ImageIcon(this.getClass().getResource("boobs.jpg"));

And if you want the java.awt.Image representation of it:

Image image = icon.getImage();

That is also a faster way of getting the image and is recommended.

Read full topic

[/php]

item.title: Making an applet load another picture upon releasing a certain key.(->)
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:24, topic:145628”]Ok, compile, no errors.

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.image.;
import java.io.;
import javax.imageio.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent.;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener.;

/**

  • This class demonstrates how to load an Image from an external file
    */
    public class LoadImageApp extends JComponent {

    BufferedImage img;
    public JFrame f;

    public void paint(Graphics g)
    {
    g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
    }

    public LoadImageApp()
    {
    loadImage();
    addKeyListener(new ButtonPress());
    }
    public void loadImage()
    {
    System.out.println(“Loading Image”);
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveLeft.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {}
    }
    public void loadNewImage()
    {
    System.out.println(“Loading New Image”);
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveRight.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {}
    }
    public Dimension getPreferredSize()
    {
    if (img == null) {
    return new Dimension(100,100);
    } else {
    return new Dimension(img.getWidth(null), img.getHeight(null));
    }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
    JFrame f = new JFrame(“Learning”);

     f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter(){
     public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) 
     {
         System.exit(0);
     }
 });
 LoadImageApp liaImgLoader = new LoadImageApp();
 f.add(liaImgLoader);
 f.pack();
 f.setVisible(true);

    }
    private class ButtonPress extends KeyAdapter
    {
    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
    {
    loadNewImage();
    switch(e.getKeyCode()){
    case 39: loadNewImage(); break;
    }
    }
    }
    public class KeyExample implements KeyListener {
    private static final String DEFAULT_RELOAD_IMAGE = “1MoveLeft.jpg”;

      BufferedImage img;

    public KeyExample() {

    }

    public void keyReleased(KeyEvent keyEvent) {
    switch(keyEvent.getKeyCode()) {
    case 39:
    reloadImage(“1MoveRight.jpg”);
    break;
    }
    }

    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent keyEvent) {

    }

    public void keyTyped(KeyEvent keyEvent) {

    }

    private void reloadImage(String fileName) {
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveRight.jpg”));
    }
    catch(IOException e) {

       }

    }
    }
    public BufferedImage loadImage(String path)
    {
    try
    {
    BufferedImage BI = ImageIO.read(new File(path));
    return BI;
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
    System.out.println(e);
    }
    return null;
    }

    public BufferedImage loadImage(File file)
    {
    try
    {
    BufferedImage BI = ImageIO.read(file);
    return BI;
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
    System.out.println(e);
    }
    return null;
    }
    }[/code]
    Nothing when I press anything…Does it matter what I press?[/quote]

maby u should add some type of listener to something?

or add a button or something?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Ok, compile, no errors.

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.image.;
import java.io.;
import javax.imageio.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent.;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener.;

/**

  • This class demonstrates how to load an Image from an external file
    */
    public class LoadImageApp extends JComponent {

    BufferedImage img;
    public JFrame f;

    public void paint(Graphics g)
    {
    g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
    }

    public LoadImageApp()
    {
    loadImage();
    addKeyListener(new ButtonPress());
    }
    public void loadImage()
    {
    System.out.println(“Loading Image”);
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveLeft.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {}
    }
    public void loadNewImage()
    {
    System.out.println(“Loading New Image”);
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveRight.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {}
    }
    public Dimension getPreferredSize()
    {
    if (img == null) {
    return new Dimension(100,100);
    } else {
    return new Dimension(img.getWidth(null), img.getHeight(null));
    }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
    JFrame f = new JFrame(“Learning”);

     f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter(){
     public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) 
     {
         System.exit(0);
     }
 });
 LoadImageApp liaImgLoader = new LoadImageApp();
 f.add(liaImgLoader);
 f.pack();
 f.setVisible(true);

    }
    private class ButtonPress extends KeyAdapter
    {
    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
    {
    loadNewImage();
    switch(e.getKeyCode()){
    case 39: loadNewImage(); break;
    }
    }
    }
    public class KeyExample implements KeyListener {
    private static final String DEFAULT_RELOAD_IMAGE = “1MoveLeft.jpg”;

      BufferedImage img;

    public KeyExample() {

    }

    public void keyReleased(KeyEvent keyEvent) {
    switch(keyEvent.getKeyCode()) {
    case 39:
    reloadImage(“1MoveRight.jpg”);
    break;
    }
    }

    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent keyEvent) {

    }

    public void keyTyped(KeyEvent keyEvent) {

    }

    private void reloadImage(String fileName) {
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“1MoveRight.jpg”));
    }
    catch(IOException e) {

       }

    }
    }
    public BufferedImage loadImage(String path)
    {
    try
    {
    BufferedImage BI = ImageIO.read(new File(path));
    return BI;
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
    System.out.println(e);
    }
    return null;
    }

    public BufferedImage loadImage(File file)
    {
    try
    {
    BufferedImage BI = ImageIO.read(file);
    return BI;
    }
    catch (IOException e)
    {
    System.out.println(e);
    }
    return null;
    }
    }[/code]
    Nothing when I press anything…Does it matter what I press?

item.dc:creator: @Galook Galook
item.description:
@Galook wrote:

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.image.;
import java.io.;
import javax.imageio.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent.;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener.;

/**

  • This class demonstrates how to load an Image from an external file
    */
    public class LoadImageApp extends JComponent {

    BufferedImage img;
    public JFrame f;

    public void paint(Graphics g)
    {
    g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
    }

    public LoadImageApp()
    {
    loadImage();
    addKeyListener(new ButtonPress());
    }
    public void loadImage()
    {
    System.out.println(“ttt”);
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“XAMPLE.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {}
    }
    public Dimension getPreferredSize()
    {
    if (img == null) {
    return new Dimension(100,100);
    } else {
    return new Dimension(img.getWidth(null), img.getHeight(null));
    }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
    JFrame f = new JFrame(“EXAMPLE”);

     f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter(){
     public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) 
     {
         System.exit(0);
     }
 });
 LoadImageApp liaImgLoader = new LoadImageApp();
 f.add(liaImgLoader);
 f.pack();
 f.setVisible(true);

    }
    private class ButtonPress extends KeyAdapter
    {
    public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
    {
    switch(e.getKeyCode()){
    case 39: loadImage(); break;
    }
    }
    }
    }[/code]

item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

I’m too tired. Can you make this:

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.image.;
import java.io.;
import javax.imageio.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent.;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener.;

/**

  • This class demonstrates how to load an Image from an external file
    */
    public class LoadImageApp extends Component {

    BufferedImage img;
    public JFrame f;

    public void paint(Graphics g) {
    g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
    }

    public LoadImageApp() {
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“XAMPLE.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {
    }

    }

    public Dimension getPreferredSize() {
    if (img == null) {
    return new Dimension(100,100);
    } else {
    return new Dimension(img.getWidth(null), img.getHeight(null));
    }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {

     JFrame f = new JFrame("EXAMPLE");
     
 f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter(){
         public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {
             System.exit(0);
         }
     });

 f.add(new LoadImageApp());
 f.pack();
 f.setVisible(true);

    }
    private class ButtonPress implements KeyListener {
    public void KeyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
    f.add(new LoadImageApp());
    f.pack();
    f.setVisible(true);
    }

     public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {

    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(EXAMPLE.jpg"));
    } catch (IOException f) {
    }

    }
    }
    [/code]
    Correctly load another image(.jpg, name doesn’t matter) when you press the right arrow key(key code is 39, if that helps)
    Thanks if you can!

item.title: Making an applet load another picture upon releasing a certain key.(->)
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

It’s because you’re not overriding the correct methods. keyTypes isn’t one of them.

http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/awt/event/KeyListener.html

It’s keyTyped, not keyTypes.

Look at the error anyways … ;|
is not abstract and does not overide abstract method keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent) in java.awt.event.KeyListener

It tells you exactly what is wrong.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Finally pwnd…

[code]import java.awt.;
import java.awt.event.;
import java.awt.image.;
import java.io.;
import javax.imageio.;
import javax.swing.;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent.;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener.;

/**

  • This class demonstrates how to load an Image from an external file
    */
    public class LoadImageApp extends Component {

    BufferedImage img;
    public JFrame f;

    public void paint(Graphics g) {
    g.drawImage(img, 0, 0, null);
    }

    public LoadImageApp() {
    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“strawberry.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException e) {
    }

    }

    public Dimension getPreferredSize() {
    if (img == null) {
    return new Dimension(100,100);
    } else {
    return new Dimension(img.getWidth(null), img.getHeight(null));
    }
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {

     JFrame f = new JFrame("Load Image Sample");
     
 f.addWindowListener(new WindowAdapter(){
         public void windowClosing(WindowEvent e) {
             System.exit(0);
         }
     });

 f.add(new LoadImageApp());
 f.pack();
 f.setVisible(true);

    }
    private class ButtonPress implements KeyListener {
    public void KeyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
    f.add(new LoadImageApp());
    f.pack();
    f.setVisible(true);
    }

     public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e) {

    try {
    img = ImageIO.read(new File(“strawberry.jpg”));
    } catch (IOException f) {
    }

    }
    }

     public void keyTypes(KeyEvent e) {

 }

}[/code]
What’s wrong with that?

That does this:

LoadImageApp.java:52: LoadImageApp.ButtonPress is not abstract and does not overide abstract method keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent) in java.awt.event.KeyListener private class ButtonPress implements KeyListener {

Then I changed keyListener to keyEvent for the hell of it, and

LoadImageApp:52: interface expected here private class ButtonPress implements KeyEvent {

item.title: Making an applet load another picture upon releasing a certain key.(->)
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Waffles!!:

Honestly, does the obvious have to be pointed out? Just need some sort of whatever that’ll load another image upon pressing and releasing a certain key.

Sorry. It just really bugs me and I’m sure lots of other people when you call methods ‘voids’. Void is the return type of the method.

Wouldn’t this work though:

First, import these:

import java.awt.event.KeyAdapter;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;

Add this to where your applet enters, when you’re adding the components:

addKeyListener(new KeyInputHandler());

Then add this at the end of the document:

private class KeyInputHandler extends KeyAdapter{
              public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e){
			repaint();
		}
}

Read full topic
